channel.title: Need help connecting to offline server!
channel.description: ME AND MY BROTHER RECENTLY CODED ALOT ON OUT SERVER AND WE NEED TO TEST SOMETHINGS SUCH AS TRADING AND MUTING. NOW, IS THERE A WAY THAT I CAN CONNECT TO THE SERVER BY NOT PUTTING THE IP IN AND STUFF? i LOGGED 2 ACCOUNTS IN FROM 2 CLIENTS, I WANT TO KNOW IF I CAN CONNECT TO THE SERVER FROM MY COMPUTER WHICH IS ON THE SAME NETWORK. THANKS.

item.title: Need help connecting to offline server!
item.dc:creator: @Brenz Brenz
item.description:
@Brenz wrote:

U cant log onto a server if its offline.

Thats like trying to cook beans on a camp fire that isnt lit.

Brendan

Read full topic

item.title: Need help connecting to offline server!
item.dc:creator: @Brenz Brenz
item.description:
@Brenz wrote:

Retard you are wrong.

On the HOSTING computer go to cmd.exe and type “ipconfig” (without the " )

Then on there look for the IPv4 or similar address, it should be your Default gateway but with a different number at the end.

Then just type that IP into the client on a computer on your network.

Brendan

Read full topic

item.source: Need help connecting to offline server!

item.title: Need help connecting to offline server!
item.dc:creator: @Retard_Monkey Retard Monkey
item.description:
@Retard_Monkey wrote:

I probably don’t understand the question being asked, but i’ll give the answer to what I think you mean anyway.

When you run the server, you can access it ONLY FROM THE HOSTING COMPUTER at 127.0.0.1 but your brother or whoever is also accessing the server will need to access the server via it’s IP. This ip is probably a no-ip unless you have not set one.

If you don’t want other people coming on your server yet because you are testing it, just delete your no-ip and get a new one which only you and your brother know. Once you’re done, get your old no-ip back which people know and hopefully they will come back online.

Read full topic
